metadata.title: CVE-2015-3415 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The sqlite3VdbeExec function in vdbe.c in SQLite before 3.8.9 does notproperly implement comparison operators, which allows context-dependentattackers to cause a denial of service (invalid free operation) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via a crafted CHECK clause, as demonstratedby CHECK(0&O>O) in a CREATE TABLE statement.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3415` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.8.10.2-1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.8.10.2-1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.8.10.2-1
sqlite3 - 3.8.10.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.10.2-1').
